info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 29 at 4:11PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF NORTHERN SAN MIGUEL AND SOUTH CENTRAL MORA COUNTIES THROUGH 445 PM MDT... At 411 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near La Cueva, or 7 miles southeast of Mora, moving northeast at 10 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Mora, La Cueva, Tierra Monte, Ledoux, Sapello, Ojo Feliz, South Carmen, Manuelitas, Golondrinas and Luceros. This includes the following highways... State Road 94 between Mile Markers 1 and 18. State Road 105 between Mile Markers 0 and 1. State Road 266 between Mile Markers 0 and 1. State Road 434 near Mile Marker 0, and between Mile Markers 2 and 5. State Road 518 between Mile Markers 12 and 29. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
